intro: Herniaria ciliolata subsp. ciliolata, commonly known as the hairy herniaria, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. This subspecies is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
